text.p: These are some of the leading stories in Kuwait's press on Monday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Kuwait says it will continue with privatisation. Parliament is studying a bill for the privatisation of public utilities.
- Kuwaiti students organise a silent march in Britain in solidarity with some 600 Kuwaitis that Kuwait says are held in Iraq since its 1990-91 occupation of the Gulf Arab state.
- Kuwait Real Estate Bank made 6.3 million dinar ($20.7 million) profit in 1996.
- Kuwait's Oil Minister Isa al-Mazeedi heads to Bahrain on Monday to inaugurate new units at Gulf Industrial Investment Company's steel project.
- Kuwait Fund for Arab Economic Development lends Bosnia 6.1 million dinars ($20 million).
- Interior Ministry plans a reshuffle after promoting 140 police officers.
- Shares plunge on fears of overheating. The government on Sunday discussed Kuwait Stock Exchange developments following warnings by some MPs of a potential crash.
